brief_summary.textblock:
The purpose of this study is to evaluate modafinil, a cocaine treatment medication, and its
      interactions with intravenous (IV) cocaine.

clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluation of Modafinil as a Cocaine Treatment Medication and Interactions With Cocaine - 1

detailed_description.textblock:
Placebo-controlled, escalating dose drug interaction study using a total of 12 cocaine users
      at a single site.  Study duration will include four infusion sessions: 1)
      screening/baseline; 2) baseline; 3) 400mg/day steady-state modafinil; 4) 800 mg/day steady
      state modafinil.  Infusion session will be 2 days in duration.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

        Dependent on cocaine; non-treatment seeking; male or female; DSM-4 criteria for cocaine
        abuse or dependence; at least 18 years of age but no older than 45 non-pregnant females
        using adequate birth control; capable of providing written informed consent; able to
        comply with protocol requirements.

        Exclusion Criteria:

        Additional criteria available during screening at the site

clinical_study.official_title: Safety Evaluation of Cocaine Treatment Medication Modafinil: Interactions With Intravenous Cocaine

oversight_info.authority: United States: Food and Drug Administration

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.study_design: Intervention Model: Crossover Assignment, Masking: Double-Blind, Primary Purpose: Treatment
